倒.definition: to invert; to place upside down or frontside back; to pour out; to tip out; to dump; inverted; upside down; reversed; to go backward; contrary to what one might expect; but; yet

倒伏.definition: (of cereal crops) to collapse and lie flat

倒休.definition: to shift holidays, taking a weekday off

倒倉.definition: to transfer grain from a store (e.g. to sun it); voice breaking (of male opera singer in puberty)

倒反.definition: instead; on the contrary; contrary (to expectations)

倒反天綱.definition: to violate the natural order; to defy social norms

倒反天罡.definition: variant of 倒反天綱|倒反天纲[dao4fan3 tian1gang1]

倒吊蠟燭.definition: Wrightia tinctoria (flowering plant in Apocynaceae family, common names dyer's oleander or pala indigo)

倒吸一口涼氣.pinyin: dao4 xi1 yi1 kou3 liang2 qi4
倒吸一口涼氣.definition: to gasp (with amazement or shock etc); to feel a chill run down one's spine; to have one's hairs stand on end

倒嗓.definition: (of a singer) to lose one's voice; (male opera singer's) voice change (at puberty)

倒塌.definition: to collapse (of building); to topple over

倒帳.definition: dead loan; bad debts; to refuse to pay loan

倒座兒.definition: the north-facing room opposite the master's in a siheyuan 四合院[si4 he2 yuan4]

倒弄.definition: to move (things around); to buy and sell at a profit (derog.)

倒彩.definition: adverse audience reaction: boos and jeers, hissing, catcalls or deliberate applause after a mistake

倒影.definition: inverted image; reversed image (e.g. upside down)

倒懸.definition: lit. to hang upside down; fig. in dire straits

倒懸之危.definition: lit. the crisis of being hanged upside down (idiom); fig. extremely critical situation; dire straits

倒懸之急.definition: lit. the crisis of being hanged upside down (idiom); fig. extremely critical situation; dire straits

倒懸之苦.definition: lit. the pain of being hanged upside down (idiom); fig. extremely critical situation; dire straits

倒戈.definition: to change sides in a war; turncoat

倒扁.definition: Taiwan political movement aimed at forcing the resignation of President Chen Shui-bian 陳水扁|陈水扁[Chen2 Shui3 bian3] in 2006 over corruption allegations

倒手.definition: to shift from one hand to the other; to change hands (of merchandise)

倒打一耙.definition: lit. to strike with a muckrake (idiom), cf Pigsy 豬八戒|猪八戒 in Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记; fig. to counterattack; to make bogus accusations (against one's victim)

倒把.definition: to play the market; to speculate (on financial markets); to profiteer

倒抽一口氣.definition: to gasp (in surprise, dismay, fright etc)

倒持泰阿.definition: lit. to present the handle of a sword to another (idiom); fig. to relinquish power to another; to place oneself at another's mercy

倒掛.definition: lit. to hang upside down; fig. topsy-turvy and inequitable, e.g. manufacturing and trading costs exceed the sale price (of some goods); to borrow more than one can ever repay

倒插門.definition: to marry and live with the bride's family (inverting traditional Chinese expectations)

倒放.definition: to place upside down; to play (a video) backwards

倒敘.definition: to start a narrative at the end (or midway), then proceed chronologically from the beginning; to flash back; flashback (in a novel, movie etc)

倒是.definition: contrary to what one might expect; actually; contrariwise; why don't you

倒時差.definition: to adjust to a different time zone

倒果為因.definition: to reverse cause and effect; to put the horse before the cart

倒栽蔥.definition: to fall headlong; (fig.) to suffer an ignominious failure

倒海翻江.definition: see 翻江倒海[fan1 jiang1 dao3 hai3]

倒灌.definition: to flow backwards (of water, because of flood, tide, wind etc); reverse flow; to back up (sewage)

倒灶.definition: to fall (from power); in decline; unlucky

倒煙.definition: to have smoke billowing from a fireplace or stove (due to a blockage in the chimney)

倒片.definition: (cinema) to rewind (a reel); (photography) to rewind (a roll of film)

倒班.definition: to change shifts; to work in turns

倒空.definition: to empty (a bag); to turn inside out; to turn out

倒立.definition: a handstand; to turn upside down; to stand on one's head; upside down

倒立像.definition: inverted image; reversed image (e.g. upside down)

倒糞.definition: to turn over manure; fig. to offend others by endlessly repeating unpleasant remarks

倒胃口.definition: to spoil one's appetite; fig. to get fed up with sth

倒背如流.definition: to know by heart (so well that you can recite it backwards)

倒背手.definition: with one's hands behind one's back

倒背手兒.definition: erhua variant of 倒背手[dao4 bei4 shou3]

倒臥.definition: to lie down; to drop dead

倒臺.definition: to fall from power; to collapse; downfall

倒血霉.definition: to have rotten luck (stronger version of 倒霉[dao3 mei2])

倒行逆施.definition: to go against the tide (idiom); to do things all wrong; to try to turn back history; a perverse way of doing things

倒買倒賣.definition: to buy and sell at a profit; to speculate

倒貼.definition: to lose money instead of being paid (i.e. sb should pay me, but is actually taking my money)

倒賣.definition: to resell at a profit; to speculate

倒賬.definition: unrecoverable debt; bad debt; to evade debt

倒車.definition: to reverse (a vehicle); to drive backwards

倒轉.definition: (of time, or a video clip etc) to run in reverse; Taiwan pr. [dao4zhuan3]

倒退.definition: to fall back; to go in reverse

倒逼.definition: (neologism c. 2006) (of circumstances) to stimulate (change, esp. innovation, reform etc)

倒過兒.definition: the wrong way round (back to front, inside out etc)

倒鎖.definition: locked in (with the door locked from the outside)

倒閉.definition: to go bankrupt; to close down

倒開.definition: to reverse a vehicle; to drive backwards

倒霉.definition: to have bad luck; to be out of luck

倒霉蛋兒.definition: erhua variant of 倒霉蛋[dao3 mei2 dan4]

倒騰.definition: to move; to shift; to exchange; to buy and sell; peddling
